Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Redis sharding client in Java that distributes keys across multiple Redis instances using consistent hashing, with support for basic CRUD operations and command execution.

Class Description: JedisSharding is a Redis client wrapper that implements sharding across multiple Redis instances. It uses consistent hashing to distribute keys and automatically manages connections to the appropriate shard for each operation.

Attributes:
- shards: List<HostAndPort> - List of Redis server addresses and ports for sharding
- clientConfig: JedisClientConfig - Configuration for Redis client connections
- hashing: Hashing - Hashing algorithm used for key distribution (defaults to MURMUR_HASH)

Methods:
- JedisSharding(List<HostAndPort>, JedisClientConfig) -> void - Constructor with default hashing algorithm
- JedisSharding(List<HostAndPort>, JedisClientConfig, Hashing) -> void - Constructor with custom hashing algorithm
- set(String, String) -> String - Stores a key-value pair in the appropriate shard
- get(String) -> String - Retrieves a value from the appropriate shard
- sendCommand(String, Protocol.Command, String...) -> Object - Sends a raw Redis command to the appropriate shard
- close() -> void - Cleans up resources (no-op as connections are managed per-operation)
- getShard(String) -> Jedis - Internal method to get a connection to the correct shard
- getShardIndex(String) -> int - Internal method to calculate shard index for a key
